@chrert : Note that the tarball built by the //tensorflow/tools/lib_package:libtensorflow bazel rule includes only files (two .sos and one .h) specific to TensorFlow. It does not package other binary dependencies (like libc, or CUDA libraries if building for GPUs etc.). So, in this case, it isn't packaging the MKL libraries either.

So you'd want the MKL libraries to be installed on the machine when you're unpacking the tarball.

@chrert : Note that the tarball built by the `//tensorflow/tools/lib_package:libtensorflow` bazel rule includes only files (two `.so`s and one `.h`) specific to TensorFlow. It does not package other binary dependencies (like `libc`, or CUDA libraries if building for GPUs etc.). So, in this case, it isn't packaging the MKL libraries either.

So you'd want the MKL libraries to be installed on the machine when you're unpacking the tarball.
